body_html:
@loretoparisi , yes it is the same error, I commented "dtype=dtype" at line 131 in translate.py file,
the error is gone, I am still running the tests. Will update again if I face any issues.

FYI,
If you open seq2seq_model.py and check in construtor of Seq2SeqModel, it assign a default value to dtype at line number 59,
def init(self,
source_vocab_size,
target_vocab_size,
buckets,
size,
num_layers,
max_gradient_norm,
batch_size,
learning_rate,
learning_rate_decay_factor,
use_lstm=False,
num_samples=512,
forward_only=False,
dtype=tf.float32):

So, even if we comment line 131 ("dtype=dtype") in translate.py file the tests should run.

@tatatodd, can you please reopen this issue? As it persists with latest tensorflow github code also.

body:
@loretoparisi , yes it is the same error, I commented "dtype=dtype" at line 131 in translate.py file, 
the error is gone, I am still running the tests. Will update again if I face any issues.

FYI,
If you open seq2seq_model.py and check in construtor of Seq2SeqModel, it assign a default value to dtype at line number 59, 
def **init**(self,
               source_vocab_size,
               target_vocab_size,
               buckets,
               size,
               num_layers,
               max_gradient_norm,
               batch_size,
               learning_rate,
               learning_rate_decay_factor,
               use_lstm=False,
               num_samples=512,
               forward_only=False,
               dtype=tf.float32):

So, even if we comment line 131 ("dtype=dtype") in translate.py file the tests should run.

@tatatodd, can you please reopen this issue? As it persists with latest tensorflow github code also.
